description: Graphical, event-driven agent dedicated to the identification of driver fusion rearrangements in human cancer through the analysis of paired-end high-throughput transcriptome sequencing data. Requires short, paired-end sequences.
name: FusionAnalyser

metadata.abstract: Gene fusions are common driver events in leukaemias and solid tumours; here we present FusionAnalyser, a agent dedicated to the identification of driver fusion rearrangements in human cancer through the analysis of paired-end high-throughput transcriptome sequencing data. We initially tested FusionAnalyser by using a set of in silico randomly generated sequencing data from 20 known human translocations occurring in cancer and subsequently using transcriptome data from three chronic and three acute myeloid leukaemia samples. in all the cases our agent was invariably able to detect the presence of the correct driver fusion event(s) with high specificity. In one of the acute myeloid leukaemia samples, FusionAnalyser identified a novel, cryptic, in-frame ETS2-ERG fusion. A fully event-driven graphical interface and a flexible filtering system allow complex analyses to be run in the absence of any a priori programming or scripting knowledge. Therefore, we propose FusionAnalyser as an efficient and robust graphical agent for the identification of functional rearrangements in the context of high-throughput transcriptome sequencing data. metadata.title: FusionAnalyser: A new graphical, event-driven agent for fusion rearrangements discovery
